page.title: 08FARMING IN AREA (CONT 2)
page.content: James Taylor's farm at Abberton has attracted a lot of visitors since he volunteered it under the Countyside Commission's Farms Project which started 1O years ago. The aim was to assess how commercial farming and conservation practices could be intigrated. Lord Belstead, Minister of State with responsibility for land use and agricultural resources recently visited the farm and was pleased to see the tree planting that had taken place as a result of Dutch Elm disease. A lot of tree planting is part of an overall plan to reshape fields for modern methods, while conserving some old habitats and creating new areas to encourage wildlife. Information based on local newspaper article September '85
